metadata.Title: CVE-2018-17937 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
gpsd versions 2.90 to 3.17 and microjson versions 1.0 to 1.3, an open source project, allow a stack-based buffer overflow, which may allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on embedded platforms via traffic on Port 2947/TCP or crafted JSON inputs.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-17937` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gpsd - 3.17-6
gpsd-clients - 3.17-6
libgps26 - 3.17-6
libqgpsmm26 - 3.17-6
python3-gps - 3.17-6
No subscription required

criterions.comment: gpsd package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.17-6').
